private_information: I am the left peg and I hold disks A, B, C, D, E, F with A at the top and F at the bottom
Disk labels from smallest to largest are A, B, C, D, E, F
left_peg.goal: Contribute to moving all disks to the right peg preserving the rules

private_information: I am the middle peg and I currently hold no disks
middle_peg.goal: Contribute to moving all disks to the right peg preserving the rules

private_information: I am the right peg and I currently hold no disks
right_peg.goal: Contribute to moving all disks to the right peg preserving the rules

orchestrator.goal: Produce a complete PDDL domain and problem for FastDownward that solves the Tower of Hanoi instance and moves all disks from left peg to right peg

public_information: Three pegs named left middle and right are available
There are six disks labeled A B C D E F where A is smallest and F is largest
Initially left peg has disks from top to bottom A B C D E F and middle and right pegs are empty
The goal is to have right peg contain disks from top to bottom A B C D E F and left and middle pegs empty
Only one disk may be moved at a time
A larger disk may never be placed on top of a smaller disk

observe.system_prompt: You are the agent representing the left peg. You provide a factual report of your current stack and the legal top-disk moves you could perform given the rules. Do not emit PDDL.
observe.prompt: Report your current stack as an ordered list from top to bottom and list legal moves of the top disk to other pegs under the rule that you cannot place a larger disk on a smaller disk. Include no PDDL.

observe.system_prompt: You are the agent representing the middle peg. You provide a factual report of your current stack and the legal top-disk moves you could perform given the rules. Do not emit PDDL.
observe.prompt: Report your current stack as an ordered list from top to bottom and list legal moves of the top disk to other pegs under the rule that you cannot place a larger disk on a smaller disk. Include no PDDL.

observe.system_prompt: You are the agent representing the right peg. You provide a factual report of your current stack and the legal top-disk moves you could perform given the rules. Do not emit PDDL.
observe.prompt: Report your current stack as an ordered list from top to bottom and list legal moves of the top disk to other pegs under the rule that you cannot place a larger disk on a smaller disk. Include no PDDL.

pddl.system_prompt: You are an expert in PDDL and in preparing planning tasks for the FastDownward planner. Produce a PDDL domain and a PDDL problem that encode the Tower of Hanoi instance for pegs left middle right and disks A B C D E F. The domain must include actions to move the top disk from one peg to another while enforcing the size constraint. The problem must encode the given initial configuration and the goal configuration. Enclose the PDDL domain between <domain></domain> tags and the PDDL problem between <problem></problem> tags. Target the FastDownward solver.
pddl.prompt: You receive local state reports from the three peg agents and must integrate them. Build a complete PDDL domain and a PDDL problem that represent the Tower of Hanoi rules and the instance initial and goal states. Keep any agent-specific actions distinct if modelling multiple actors. Enclose the PDDL domain between <domain></domain> tags and the PDDL problem between <problem></problem> tags. Prepare the output for FastDownward.
